newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products mostly ease, low sulphur stable.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products mostly ease, low sulphur stable.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were unchanged to slightly weaker, traders said.
Gas oil weakened on easier IPE futures and premiums for heating oil and low sulphur diesel were pressured by poor demand.
"It's really lacklustre," one trader in the region said. Russian was discussed at quotes high +$1 basis Genoa.

Attention focussed on the award on Thursday of a Turkish tender for two 10,000-tonne cargoes of Turkish import grade 0.5 heating oil for delivery into Tutunciftlik, with the result expected to give direction to premiums.
Gasoline prices were little changed as early gains were given up in the afternoon when U.S. prices fell about 0.5 cent a gallon.
Dealers said premium unleaded was tracking barges at a discount of $2.00 a tonne on an fob Italy basis.

Naphtha was weaker in line with crude futures, but physical discussion was thin, traders said. A full-range Egyptian cargo was still seen on offer at quotes cif high +$4 a tonne, cif Lavera. Buyers were seen to be fairly relaxed.
Fuel oil was weaker, in line with lower crude prices.
Some dealers also thought there was pressure to push prices lower in anticipation of pricing in the next few days of a couple of large cargoes.
High sulphur cracked cargoes were knocked down to $113-115 fob Med although buyers would only look at floating prices. Paper was heard, but not done, at $112.50.
Low sulphur was broadly steady, taking a little comfort from a fading likelihood that Caribbean material would seek a home in the Med because of strong U.S. prices.
